params.question: Let \(X\) be a non-empty set and \(P(X)\) be the set of all subsets of \(X\). On \(P(X)\), define two operations \(*\) and \(\Delta \) as follows: for \(A, B \in P(X)\), \(A * B = A \cap B\); \(A \Delta B = (A \cup B) \setminus (A \cap B)\). Which of the following statements is true?

answers.text: \(P(X)\) is a group under \(*\) as well as under \(\Delta \)
\(P(X)\) is a group under \(*\) but not under \(\Delta \)
\(P(X)\) is a group under \(\Delta \) but not under \(*\)
\(P(X)\) is neither a group under \(*\) nor under \(\Delta \)
